title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has defended Home Affairs Minister Peter Dutton, who angered China with comments about the Communist Party. The Chinese embassy condemned Mr Dutton for using a so-called "malicious slur" and damaging the two nations' relationship. Mr Dutton is being criticised for suggesting Australia has the right to "call out" countries for skirting the law or threatening democratic values. The prime minister said Mr Dutton's intentions were good Saturday during his visit to Fiji. Image: News Corp Australia
